CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. 13, reads: "Love's Labor's Lost...Sometimes Home is Where the Heart Remains - Merchant Homestead - What remains of the homestead of the Merchant family. The last survivor was Florence Merchant, affectionately known as 'Merch.'  Her father built this home from his meager earnings as truck driver for a grocery store."
TitMainTitle: Three story frame house with broken windows, overgrown lawn with three trees, and man wearing dark hat standing next to car on left, possibly Hill District
